rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/152.163.101.12|152.163.101.12]] to last version by Cubdriver

/* Support for use of atomic bombs */ consensus meant military could prevent surrender
/* Support for use of atomic bombs */ added WWII combat deaths for perspective
/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */ U.S. didn't know the USSR *would* go to war, nor that the date was Aug 8.
/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */ 120,000 is not "several hundred thousands"!
/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */
/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */
/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */ crime against humanity, google nagasaki "crime against humanity" gives 24,900 hits...

/* Opposition to use of atomic bombs */
/* Support for use of atomic bombs */ recently added text "for the course of the war" seems wrong, since the figures given are for operation downfall only
/* Support for use of atomic bombs */
"cities" does not need to be wikilinked, and the Hiroshima and Nagasaki links were redirects
/* Debates over the bombings, and their portrayal */ fmt; copyedit; add one classic book, rm one dup ref (is in the previous section)
/* Histories of the events */ fmt, add ref
/* Support for use of atomic bombs */
Cleaned up the writing in opening section, removed recent addition that Japan surrendered because of the "aftereffects" of bombings.
rv. see talk page and explain your position specifically and coherently
hey whole hiroshima and nagasaki, electricty and all that was disabled, the whole cities were wiped out, and the image is still being used once in this article, i switched it.
rv. no underplaying, only: 1. image is already used in the article once; 2. effect of bombing to surrender is item of contention as article explains; 3. line about radiation is not completely correct
again, don't try to underplay this nuclear bombing, how would you feal if japan dropped two atomic bombs on chicago and new york.
there don't try to underplay the nuclear attack by just showing wrecked up building.
reduce unnecessary overlinking/ copyediting of intro, notably not attributing surrender to bombing since the next paragraph discusses the controversy relating to that. rm vague term "casualty".
adjusting kill total to match the minimums in the article text
/* Japanese realization of the bombing */ fixing misc vandalism
restoring original image. This one is a bit gaudy and is mis-labeled anyhow (if you look further down the page, you'll see it's the Nagasaki cloud, not the Hiroshima one)
